titleStmt.title: Dǝrsāna sanbata krǝstiyān “Homily on the Sabbath of Christians”

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens und Eritreas: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / Beta maṣāḥǝft

licence.p: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msContents.summary:
I) Dәrsanä sanbata krǝstiyān “Homily on the Sabbath of Christians” (Homily on the observance of Sunday, ascribed to Jacob of Serug)(fols. 3r–35r [l.7])
Additio 1.

msItem.title: Dǝrsāna sanbata krǝstiyān “Homily on the Sabbath of Christians” (Homily on the observance of Sunday, ascribed to Jaqob of Serug)
msItem.incipit: 3r: በስመ፡ አብ፡ ወወልደ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ [n.l.] ዘሥሩግ፡ በእንተ፡ ሰንበተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ቅድስት፡ ዘደረሰ፡ [ርቱዓ፡ ሃይማኖት፡] ጸሎታ፡ ምስለ፡ [n.l.] ወልደ፡ ትንሣኤ [n.l.] … 3r: In the name of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit … which [Jaqob] of Serug, Orthodox in faith, composed on St Sabbath of Christians … [May] her prayer be with … Walda Tǝnśāʾe …
msItem.explicit: 34v, l.21 – 35r (l.7): ...ወአድኅነኒ፡ ወለዝንቱ፡ መጽ[35r]ሐፍ፡ ዘአጽሐፋ፡ ኅብኦ፡ እምሀከክ፡ ለአቡነ፡ ወልደ፡ ትንሣኤ፡ ዕቁባ፡ ሊባኖስ፡ ላህየ፡ ድንግል፡ ወደቂቆሙ፡ ገብረ፡ ሕይወት፡ ወልደ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ወልደ ማርያም፡ ሰሎሞን፡ ገብረ፡ ጊዮርጊስ። ወለጸሐፊሃኒ፡ ወልደ፡ ሙሴ፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን። 34v, l.21 – 35r (l.7): ... And save me; and for the one who let this book be written, hide him from the commotion, namely ʾabuna Walda Tǝnśāʾe, ʿƎquba Libānos, Lahǝyä Dǝngǝl, Gabra Ḥǝywat, Walda Yoḥannǝs, Walda Māryām, Sälomon, Gabra Giyorgis, and its scribe, Walda Muse, forever and ever. Amen.

msContents.colophon: 35r, l.7: (This) is the Homily of the Sabbath of (the church of) ʾabuna Libānos Mäsṭǝh, which ʾabuna Walda Tǝnśāʾe donated so that it would be the guide to the Kingdom of Heaven. O you, priests, don´t be idle each week [for] the Sabbath, sacred and glorious among all the days.

supportDesc.extent:
Made of 35.0 folios, of which 3.0 blank 1rv, 2rv, 35v, in 5.0 quires (A + 4).
185 120 32
supportDesc.condition: Many leaves are damaged by humidity or very worn (e.g. 3r, 8r, 12v, 13r, 15v, 16r, 17v, 18r, 19rv, 20rv, 21v). The text on 3r is mostly unreadable.

layout.ab: The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

list.item: II. Four dot asterisk (e.g. fols.: 6v, l.5; 9v, ls. 5, 7; 11v, l.1; 34v, l.1; 35r; ls. 6, 7, 11);
nine dot asterisk (used throughout the text);

decoNote.locus: Simple ornamental band at the beginning of the text (geometric motifs):

item.quote: 35r, l.7: ዝድርሳነ፡ ሰንበት፡ ዘአቡነ፡ ሊባኖስ፡ መስጥህ፡ ዘወሀቦ፡ አቡነ፡ ወልደ፡ ትንሣኤ፡ ከመ፡ ትኩኖ፡ መርሃ፡ ለመንግሥተ፡ ሰማያት። ኦአንትሙ፡ ካህናት፡ ኢታጽርኡ፡ ለለሰሙኑ፡ ሰንበት፡ ቅድስት፡ ወክብርት፡ እምኵሎን፡ ዕለታት። ።

35r, l.7: This Homily of the Sabbath of (the church of) ʾabuna Libānos Mäsṭǝh which ʾabuna Walda Tǝnśāʾe donated so that it would be for him the guide to the Kingdom of Heaven. Oh you, priests, don't be idle each week (for) the sacred Sabbath, the most glorious among all days.

list.item: - Crude notes on 1r-2v (writing exercises?), 12v (in the bottom margin), 13r (in the bottom margin), 17r (in the upper margin), 30v (in the upper margin), 35r (in the bottom margin), 35v.

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards; two pairs of sewing stations.

origin.origDate: This Ms. is not dated; however, it is possible to deduce the period of its production from the name of the scribe, Walda Muse (35r, l.6). The same name is mentioned in Ms. MR-023, which is dated between 1872 and 1876.

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

person.persName:
ʾabuna Walda Tǝnśāʾe (mentioned as the commissioner and donor on 35r, l.2; cp. also 3r, ls. 6-7; 5v, l.4; 10r, ls. 8-9; 22v, l.15; 25r, l.21; 32v, l.1; 35, ls. 2, 9). Besides, some other persons are mentioned: ʿƎquba Libānos (32v, l.2; 35r, ls. 2-3); Lahǝyä Dǝngǝl (35r, ls. 2-3); Gabra Ḥǝywat (35r, l.4); Walda Yoḥannǝs (35r, l.4); Walda Māryām (35r, ls. 4-5); Sälomon (35r, l.5); Gabra Giyorgis (35r, ls. 5-6).
Ms. MR-016 was commissioned by the same donors.

revisionDesc.change: transformed from mycore to TEI P5
